intro: Dimeria kanjirapallilana, commonly known as the Kanjirapally dimeria, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
